result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Leandra Rae Sessions was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:
A.  A probation violation will be considered a violation of this agreement.
B.  Possession or consumption of drugs without a valid prescription will be considered a violations of this agreement.

judgments.dispoDesc: Dismissed on Court's Own Motion.  DPA expired without revocation.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs/surcharges according to a schedule as set forth by Probation & Parole.

timeConds.notes:
Complete 80 hours of community service.  Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council.
AMENDED:  03-02-2015 - Terminated from community service for failure to comply with the program.

AMENDED 03-16-2015:  Court modifies probation to add 20 days in the Pepin County Jail with work release commencing 5/07/2015 & stay 10 days if by 5/07/2015 defendant pays all court ordered obligations and stay 10 days if defendant completes her 80 hours of community service as approved by Probation & Parole Agent.
AMENDED 05-18-2015:  Confirmation received defendant completed her community service and court ordered obligations are paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leandra Rae Sessions

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Count 1 Dismissed on Court's Own Motion.  DPA expired without revocation.
Letter from DOC Agent advising Ms. Session paid all her court ordered obligations on 5/7.  She miscalculated community service and has 2 hours left which she needs to complete asap.
Letter from Leandra Sessions inquiring to sit jail time instead of community service.

Defendant Leandra Rae Sessions now appears.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires of defendant the letter she sent to allow her to sit 10 days jail instead of completing community service.  Ms. Sessions ask to be allowed to complete the C/S and extend probation if need to until it's done.  She informs the court she can pay the amount owing on her last day of probation.  Court modifies probation to add 20 days in the Pepin County Jail with work release com. 5/7/15 & stay 10 days if by 5/7 she pays all court ordered obs.; if turns in 80 hours of community service as approved by P&P agent by 5/7/15, won't need to serve the 10 days jail.

Defendant Leandra Rae Sessions not in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was ordered to complete 80 hrs. community service and failed to do so.  Modify probation and order 10 days jail with work release com. 4/1/15.  For unpaid court ordered obligations, order to serve an addt'l 14 days on 5/1/15 unless by that date, defendant pays in full.
Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S for failure to comply with the program.
DOC Notice - Oblications Due:  Court Obs.
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Condition of Probation:  Complete 80 hours of community service by 03-01-2015.  Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council.

Defendant Leandra Rae Sessions in court with attorney Susan T Falch.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs court of plea agreement to Counts 1 & 3.  Counsel agrees to using Count 1 & 3 of the Complaint for purposes of the Information.    Judge advises defendant of elements of count 1 & count 3/max. penalties on each.  Defendant pleads no contest on each count.  PLQ/WRF filed with the Court & reviewed with defendant.  Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea in Count 3 and finds defendant guilty.  Court defers acceptance of defendant's plea in Count 1 and approves DPA.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 1 year probation with conditions.  Appeal rights given.  14TR128 dismissed.

Defendant Leandra Rae Sessions in court with attorney Susan T Falch.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs the Court of plea agreement.  Court advises defendant of right to preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives right to prelim. hrg.

Defendant Leandra Rae Sessions in court with attorney Susan T Falch.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request another date, close to agreement. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Leandra Rae Sessions in court with attorney Susan T Falch.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
